docs.snippet: Frank Lampard will be England's vice-captain at next month's World Cup in Brazil, manager Roy Hodgson said on Sunday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Frank Lampard will be England's vice-captain at next month's World Cup in Brazil, manager Roy Hodgson said on Sunday.

headline.main: Lampard Named England Vice-Captain in Brazil
headline.print_headline: Lampard Named England Vice-Captain in Brazil

docs.snippet: Uruguay will exempt marijuana production and sales from taxes in a bid to ensure prices remain low enough to undercut competition from black market pot smuggled in from Paraguay, according to consultants advising the government on a legalization...
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay will exempt marijuana production and sales from taxes in a bid to ensure prices remain low enough to undercut competition from black market pot smuggled in from Paraguay, according to consultants advising the government on a legalization plan.

headline.main: Uruguay to Sell Marijuana Tax-Free to Undercut Drug Traffickers
headline.print_headline: Uruguay to Sell Marijuana Tax-Free to Undercut Drug Traffickers

docs.snippet: Lionel Messi signed a new contract with Barcelona on Monday that will reportedly make the four-times World Player of the Year soccer's best-paid player with a net annual salary of 20 million euros (16.3 million pounds).
docs.lead_paragraph: Lionel Messi signed a new contract with Barcelona on Monday that will reportedly make the four-times World Player of the Year soccer's best-paid player with a net annual salary of 20 million euros (16.3 million pounds).

headline.main: Messi Signs Improved Contract With Barcelona
headline.print_headline: Messi Signs Improved Contract With Barcelona

docs.snippet: England coach Roy Hodgson has warned his players to sacrifice their egos for the good of the team at the World Cup lest they end up like the strife-torn France side of the 2010 finals.
docs.lead_paragraph: England coach Roy Hodgson has warned his players to sacrifice their egos for the good of the team at the World Cup lest they end up like the strife-torn France side of the 2010 finals.

headline.main: Hodgson Warns England Players of Perils of Team Disharmony
headline.print_headline: Hodgson Warns England Players of Perils of Team Disharmony

docs.snippet: Italy striker Giuseppe Rossi has 10 days to prove he is fit and ready for action in the World Cup in Brazil, national manager Cesare Prandelli said on Tuesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Italy striker Giuseppe Rossi has 10 days to prove he is fit and ready for action in the World Cup in Brazil, national manager Cesare Prandelli said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Italy's Rossi Must Prove He's Ready for Action-Prandelli
headline.print_headline: Italy's Rossi Must Prove He's Ready for Action-Prandelli

docs.snippet: A federal judge on Wednesday brushed aside the Justice Department's objections and ordered the government to produce 34 videotapes of a hunger-striking prisoner at the Guantanamo Bay naval base.
docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge on Wednesday brushed aside the Justice Department's objections and ordered the government to produce 34 videotapes of a hunger-striking prisoner at the Guantanamo Bay naval base.

headline.main: Judge: Produce Gitmo Videotapes, Medical Records
headline.print_headline: Judge: Produce Gitmo Videotapes, Medical Records

docs.snippet: Neither England nor Italy can afford to lose next month's World Cup opener in Brazil, former Italy and Chelsea striker Gianfranco Zola said on Wednesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Neither England nor Italy can afford to lose next month's World Cup opener in Brazil, former Italy and Chelsea striker Gianfranco Zola said on Wednesday.

headline.main: England, Italy Cannot Afford to Lose Cup Opener-Zola
headline.print_headline: England, Italy Cannot Afford to Lose Cup Opener-Zola

docs.snippet: England's World Cup squad have been training in sweat vests in Portugal as coach Roy Hodgson prepares them for the heat they will encounter in their opening match against Italy in the Brazilian city of Manaus.
docs.lead_paragraph: England's World Cup squad have been training in sweat vests in Portugal as coach Roy Hodgson prepares them for the heat they will encounter in their opening match against Italy in the Brazilian city of Manaus.

headline.main: England Players Get a Sweat On in Portugal
headline.print_headline: England Players Get a Sweat On in Portugal

docs.snippet: Uruguay are hopeful striker Luis Suarez will be fit for the World Cup finals after having surgery on his left knee on Thursday, team doctors said.
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay are hopeful striker Luis Suarez will be fit for the World Cup finals after having surgery on his left knee on Thursday, team doctors said.

headline.main: Uruguay's Suarez Has Knee Surgery Before World Cup
headline.print_headline: Uruguay's Suarez Has Knee Surgery Before World Cup
